TopicTitle: How do you make another copy of Kerbal?

Articles.Content:
Well, basically, how do you make another copy of KSP? 1.0 WILL break mods, and I want to keep my current 0.90.0 version, and have another, stock game in 1.0. I see that youtubers have done it,but they never explain how. So, how?![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-24T23:11:09Z" title="04/24/2015 11:11  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 24, 2015</time> by Rolanvorxariat**

Go to the installation folder. Right click it. Click Copy. Go somewhere else, right click. Click Paste.

If you are using Steam the installation folder will be Steam\SteamApps\common\Kerbal Space Program

> 
> Go to the installation folder. Right click it. Click Copy. Go somewhere else, right click. Click Paste.
> If you are using Steam the installation folder will be Steam\SteamApps\common\Kerbal Space Program

How do you update one, but keep the other in its current state?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-25T01:18:17Z" title="04/25/2015 01:18  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 25, 2015</time> by Rolanvorxariat**

Just make a copy of the game folder ("Kerbal Space Program") on "C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\". Something like "Kerbal Space Program 0.90". The "normal" folder will still be updated by steam while the new folder you make will be untouched.
